ingredients: 1 kg chicken (bone-in, cut into medium pieces)
3 cups basmati rice (or Jeerakasala rice for authenticity)
Whole spices (4 cardamoms, 4 cloves, 2-inch cinnamon, 1 bay leaf)
3 tablespoons refined oil or coconut oil

steps.title: Soak the Rice
steps.description: Wash the basmati or Jeerakasala rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Cook the Rice
steps.description: Boil water in a large pot, add salt and whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf). Add soaked rice and cook until it is 90% done. Drain the rice and set it aside.

steps.title: Fry Onions
steps.description: Heat oil and 2 tablespoons of ghee in a deep pan. Fry the thinly sliced onions on medium heat until golden brown and crispy.

steps.title: Separate Onions for Garnish
steps.description: Remove half of the fried onions and set them aside for garnishing later.

steps.title: Sauté Whole Spices
steps.description: In the remaining oil, add whole spices (if not already used in rice) and sauté briefly until aromatic.

steps.title: Add Ginger-Garlic and Chilies
steps.description: Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.

steps.title: Cook Onions for Masala
steps.description: Add the remaining fried onions back into the pan and sauté for a few minutes until soft and well-mixed.

steps.title: Add Tomatoes and Spices
steps.description: Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil starts separating from the masala.

steps.title: Add Yogurt
steps.description: Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt. Mix well to form a thick gravy base.

steps.title: Cook Chicken
steps.description: Add the chicken pieces. Mix to coat them well with the masala. Cover and cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through.

steps.title: Reduce Masala
steps.description: Uncover and continue to cook until the gravy thickens and clings to the chicken.

steps.title: Prepare for Layering
steps.description: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spoon in half of the chicken masala as the first layer.

steps.title: Layer Rice and Garnishes
steps.description: Add a layer of cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle fried onions, chopped mint, coriander leaves, lemon juice, and a drizzle of ghee.

steps.title: Repeat Layers
steps.description: Repeat layering with remaining chicken, rice, and garnishes. Ensure the final layer is rice topped with fried onions and herbs.

steps.title: Seal the Pot
steps.description: Seal the lid tightly or use dough to secure the edges, preventing steam from escaping during cooking.

steps.title: Dum Cook the Biryani
steps.description: Place the pot on low heat or on a preheated griddle (tava) and cook for 20-25 minutes. This slow steaming helps flavors meld beautifully.

steps.title: Fry Cashews and Raisins
steps.description: In a small pan, heat remaining ghee and fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden.

steps.title: Garnish and Serve
steps.description: Open the biryani pot carefully. Sprinkle the fried cashews and raisins on top. Serve hot with raita, pickle, and pappadam.
